summary: Sumer, found in modern-day Iraq, was one of the first civilizations, starting around 6000-5000 BC. It's considered a "cradle of civilization," like ancient Egypt and the Indus Valley. Sumerians lived near the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, where they farmed and created the first cities due to their successful agriculture. They also developed early forms of writing, with the oldest texts from around 3350-2500 BC.
title: Sumer
